conversations.content: Please note that this story contains spoilers for both the Faith Forsaken (Part Two) and One Starry Dragonyule events.
Our next mission is to secure a key to perdition and claim one of the Scrolls of Perdition. Quite the responsibility.
Indeed. Precisely as the name suggests, these keys are required to gain access to the Scrolls.
Which means another new Scroll may be loosed upon the world if we fail...
Not an exaggeration to say the fate of the Ilian Church rests on this mission. Do we know the key's location?
The details are still being investigated. The mission will officially begin once the whereabouts have been determined.
At present, we know only that the key resides somewhere in the frozen north.
...Lovely. Never been a fan of the cold, myself. I'm an ideas man, not a snowman. I'd rather leave the extreme climes to someone else.
Yes, but as they are counting on that mind of yours, why not try being motivated? You know—as a novelty.
Indeed, you two were judged to be the best fit for this task due to its highly confidential and uncertain nature.
That means they believe that out of all the apostles, you, Nevin, are the one they trust most to be able to adapt on the fly.
Thanks for the in-depth analysis, Pops.
All right, well, if they're going to pile the expectations on me, I suppose I should actually try to meet 'em.
I do look forward to seeing that, as well as observing how much you're grown.
And I'm eager for you to finally stop seeing me as a kid.
A few days later...
Ooh, I like this! Warm and windproof? Cozy and comfy? Sometimes it's worth it to spend the extra coin for bespoke.
And hoo boy, it was a LOT of coin. But hey, let's just call it an early Dragonyule present to myself.
We're putting up the Yuletree! Come lend a hand!
Yesss! I'm on the way!
We've got more ornaments this year than ever before!
Looks like everyone in town is in full-on Dragonyule mode.
Too bad I can't join the fun. But sadly, there's no such thing as a vacation in the apostle biz.
Hee hee! Daddy!
Huh? Daddy? Kid, do I look old enough to be your... Wait, don't answer that.
Oops! I'm sorry, mister. Your coat's the same color as my daddy's.
*sniff* But...where'd he go?
(Looks like the kid's lost.)
*sniffle* *sniff* WAAAAAAH!
Whoa, hold off on the waterworks, kid! Folks are gonna think I did something.
Sorry... *sniff*
Ugh. Fine, I'll help you find your old man. What's he look like?
(Kid's wearing foreign duds, so they're probably tourists. That should make it easier to predict Dad's movements.)
There he is! DADDY!
Oh, thank goodness! I've been looking everywhere for you, Son!
Aaaand...case closed. Not that there was ever any doubt with me on the job.
Were you helping him look for me? Thank you, kind sir. Truly.
*sniffle* I was scared, Daddy...
Yes, and the fault is mine. I was so caught up in taking in the sights that I took my eyes off you for a moment.
Perhaps you will permit me to make it up to you with a present? Anything you like!
Really...?
Really. This land has a celebration called Dragonyule where you give gifts to those you love, and there is none I love in the world more than you.
Yaaay! I love you too, Daddy! ...Oh, and I want that thing we saw back in the store!
Jeez, kids are straightforward animals. Bawling their eyes out one minute, drooling over a gift the next.
Still, Dragonyule presents, eh? Man, that takes me back...
Huh? I can really have this?
Of course. Today is Dragonyule, after all.
Thanks, Ramiel! I'll take good care of it!
(I used to lose my little mind every time Ramiel gave me a Dragonyule gift.)
(Hard to believe I was ever that innocent.)
All right, that's enough embarrassing flashbacks for one evening, Nevin. Time to go to work.
Need to make sure I'm prepared to head out on a moment's notice whenever Sandalphon calls.
Let's see, next on the list is...
Ah! You're back, Nevin!
Huh? What's with that look, Pinon? Did something happen?
It certainly did! You see...
(Oh, for the love of... THIS is what Pinon needs me for?)
Ooo, this ribbon is terrifically cute! Ah, but that hair clip is so nice...
(Kid apparently can't make up her mind about what to give Gabriel for Dragonyule. Talk about your crisis of crises.)
So, um, which of these you think Gabriel would prefer?
It's your gift. Pick it yourself.
You are simply saying as much to weasel out of making a choice. Now please, I need an honest opinion here.
While I very much want to weasel out of this, that's not my only reason. Truth is, no answer I could give would help you.
I'm only asking you because I find myself incapable of deciding for myself.
Okay, thought exercise. Let's say I pick one of these and you give it to Gabriel.
Is it really your present anymore?
Of course it is! ...Wait. IS it?
Putting time and thought into a gift is what gives it meaning in the first place.
Yes, I suppose you're right. This is meant to be my way of showing gratitude for the most important person in my life, after all.
I need to make up my own mind on the matter.
And Gabriel will be all the happier for it.
I'm sorry I dragged you out here for this. But so long as you're here, why not do a little gift shopping of your own?
I'm good, thanks.
You're not giving a thank-you gift to Ramiel?
Nah, it's not really my style. I'll leave that to my favorite dead-serious rookie.
Besides, that devil of an angel would just poke fun at me if I got him something.
As much as I hate to admit it, I imagine you're right. But even so, are you certain you won't regret not doing anything?
What would I have to regret?
Not communicating how thankful you are to the person who raised you, for one.
Our missions always have us walking the razor's edge—an edge the angels have already crossed once.
HAAAAAAAAAAAH!
No... I can't leave...before my son...
This can't be happening...
I was filled with regret in those dark days, for I knew I hadn't come close to showing Gabriel how much I appreciate her.
So this year, I'll celebrate Dragonyule with her and ensure she knows just how thankful I am to have her.
A person only gets so many chances to say such things, and now I know how much I'll regret it if I don't.
Don't you have anything to tell him? Something you'd regret leaving unsaid?
A few things, yeah. And hate to disappoint, but in my case it ain't ＂thank you.＂
All I want is to show him my commitment and resolve to stand as his equal—and I already told him that when he came back.
I think the once was enough; some words ring hollower the more you say them.
That makes sense. While gratitude can be expressed over and over, continuous professions of resolve often sound like you're attempting to convince yourself.
Exactly—which means Papa Bear's already said everything he needs to.
My apologies for sticking my nose into your relationship with Ramiel.
Eh, you're fine. Now if you don't mind, I'm gonna leave you to sweat over that present a bit more.
Yes, the hair clip or the ribbon? It's quite the conundrum.
Oh, and thank you for everything, Nevin. I feel confident I can show Gabriel just how I feel now.
Glad to hear it. I'm sure Gabriel will be a sobbing mess when she opens it.
I'm not even kidding. You know she's going to be so overcome with emotion that she starts bawling.
That's not... Oh, who am I kidding? You're right—and now I'm suddenly feeling oddly embarrassed.
Ha ha ha! Well then, keep on blushing. But just remember this is your last chance to avoid the flood zone, so you can still put that gift back if you want.
I'm not putting it back! I promised to live without regrets, and I meant it.
Then I guess you better get wrapping.
(No more regrets, huh?)
(I already told Ramiel what I felt when I lost him, but what if it happened again?)
(If he up and vanished again before I'd ever bothered to say thank you, I'd be...)
Gyaaa! Rrrgh... This one's no joke.
Our foe possesses a power even greater than Satan's. At this rate...
I fear I've no other choice. It is time for my last resort...
What are you doing, Ramiel?! You're not going to sacrifice yourself again, are you?!
Ramiel, no! NO! COME BAAAACK!
I still haven't told you everything! I still haven't thanked you!
RAMIEEEEEEL!
GYAAAAA! ...Huh? What happened? Where's Ramiel? What was...?
Ugh. A dream? My brain's got some damned poor taste in nighttime entertainment, I tell you what.
Feels like I woke myself up shouting some cringeworthy line.
Something about not having thanked him? Blech. Total cornball, that.
Still, Pinon said we only get so many chances to tell someone how we feel...
Hell, maybe I SHOULD get him something.
...But c'mon. Am I really the Dragonyule present type? ME? Papa Bear?
Nevin? Might I have a word?
BLARGH!
Mmm? What has you so flustered?
I'm good, I'm fine, everything's fine. Anyway, you needed something?
I'm worried as to whether you've properly prepared for our mission to the north.
You can be very sloppy sometimes. Why, I can't recall how many times you put off your homework to the very last minute.
Sorry, how many decades ago was this? I'm not a kid anymore, Ramiel.
I'm a grown-arse man who does his job well, and I'm ready to leave anytime.
I'm relieved to hear it—and I suppose it is a favorable sign of growth.
Though you still leave your room a terrific mess, so perhaps this ＂grown-arse＂ man can learn to make a bed?
Okay, enough! We both know you're just needling me for the sick pleasure of it, so if you've said your piece, beat it!
I swear, there's snark in every breath out of that devil angel. A guy leaves ONE speck of dust on top of a cabinet and...
Actually, wait. Where's the stuff I packed? I thought I left it right here.
Ah, here we go. Holy water...check. Halo...check. Emergency rations...
Huh? Where'd I put those? I know I just bought a fresh stock.
Welp, looks like they're missing, so guess I'd better shell out for new ones. AGAIN.
...There we go. Yeesh. Better not lose 'em this time.
Welcome to our limited-time sale, friend!
Everything on this shelf is 30 percent off! Why, you'd need a broadsword to cut these prices any further!
Can't say I'd mind saving a little dough, so might as well take a look.
...Say, this earring is exactly the sort of thing Ramiel would wear.
As presents go, he might actually like it.
Ugh, listen to me. Nope! Nope, nope. We're not doing this.
Ah, but you have excellent taste, sir! That piece was created by a master craftsman of exquisite skill—there's only one like it in all the world!
You don't say?
Indeed, sir! In fact, the artisan who crafted it swore to Ilia herself that it was his finest work to date!
But a man with your keen eye does not need me to sell him on so fine an item. Would you care to try it on, sir?
Oh, uh, it's not for me.
Ah, I only wish I had one such as yourself in my life to give me so fine a present! Now then, we offer a number of wrapping options, as well as a selection of cards.
Slow down there, silver tongue! I still ain't even decided if I'm buying or not!
...Thank you for your purchase, sir! Do come again!
Man, that gal is a smooth talker! Can't believe I walked out of there with an earring. I think maybe she hypnotized me?
Ah, well. What's done is done.
Might as well give it to Ramiel now. I mean, it IS his style...
Now the only problem is when and how to give this thing to Ramiel.
(Probably don't wanna do it with other angels and apostles around—and especially not Pinon.)
(Not after all my tough talk about not being the type to give Dragonyule gifts.)
(That means I have to catch Ramiel alone.)
(Okay, looks like the coast is clear...)
Heya, Ramiel. Got a minute?
I do. Is there something you need?
Well, not something I NEED necessarily, so much as...um...
(Ugh. Come on, words! Get out already!)
(Just hand it to him with a brisk, ＂Here's a little something to thank you for all you've done over the years.＂ How hard is that?)
It seems this is a sensitive matter, Nevin. Shall we relocate?
Nah, we're fine. It's nothing big.
(You hear me, brain?! Stop making this a deal and just give it to him already!)
(We're up against the angel of snark, and the longer this drags out, the more crap he's gonna give you for it!)
Ramiel, I... What I mean is... Look, I want to give—
One moment, please. I'm being contacted by Sandalphon.
Uh...yeah, sure.
(Right when I was about to be rid of this  thing too! I know one Sandalphon-shaped angel that's getting coal this year...)
Hey, wait. Sandalphon's contacting you? Is this about the thing?!
It is indeed. We've been given an urgent summons regarding the special mission we spoke of earlier.
Heed my words: The whereabouts of the key to perdition have been determined.
It lies north amid the snowy mountains, in the city said to be the birthplace of the Dragonyule tradition.
Apostle Nevin. Angel Ramiel. You are to deploy there immediately and secure the key to perdition, and then proceed to recover the Scroll of Perdition.
Understood. I assume you're prepared to depart, Nevin?
I'm good to go whenever, but...
Is there a problem?
...No, we're good. Don't worry about it.
Orders received. By the Goddess' name, I shall see Her will executed.
...All right. That's everything I'll need for the mission.
And then we have...this. Can't exactly call a brightly wrapped gift mission-critical.
Well, time to go. From here on out, I'm on the clock.
And so Nevin and Ramiel departed for the land where Dragonyule began.
Despite some curious turns along the way, they succeeded in their task and laid claim to a new Scroll of Perdition.
But by the time they returned home, Dragonyule had come and gone.
Well, THAT was a rough one. Good thing they sent their ace, or who knows how it would've ended up?
Now I just need to figure out what the heck I'm doing with this thing.
Maybe I should give up on it this year. There's few things more awkward than giving someone a belated gift.
I feel a little bad for the artisan and the shopkeep who went to the trouble of wrapping it up all nice, but...
Blech. They say the Goddess grants miracles on Dragonyule, but I clearly haven't earned one yet.
Guess maybe this is Her way of telling me to stop doing things out of character.
A few days after throwing out Ramiel's present...
Are you free today, Nevin?
Don't think I've got anything planned.
Excellent. Then please come with me.
Wait, where are we going?
You'll see once we arrive. Now, no more dallying. March!
WHOA! What's with the feast, Ramiel?! This much food would cost a fortune!
I had this meal prepared for you. Do sit down.
Okay, will you PLEASE tell me what the heck's going on here?
Let us discuss that later, lest all of this fine food go cold. Eat, Nevin!
This is making me very uncomfortable... but I'm also not about to waste a spread like this! *chomp* *horf* *snort*
...Phew! Oh man, if the Goddess ever asks me to join Her in heaven, I can now admit that I've already been there.
So are you finally ready to tell me what all this chow is about, Ramiel?
This dinner is my way of repaying you for the lovely gift.
Gift?! Wh-what are you talking about? I didn't get you a damn thing!
Is that so? Then please do tell me what this might be.
What?! HEY! I know for a fact I threw that box and everything inside it away!
Indeed. And speaking of garbage, your room was so littered with it I couldn't help but tidy up, which is how I found this.
Have you ever heard of privacy? Also, that explains why my room felt so much bigger recently...
If you would prefer I not intervene in your affairs, perhaps you might consider addressing them yourself.
Look, your breaking into my home in order to clean it isn't the real issue here.
What I want to know is why you went into my room, saw a gift I'd clearly thrown out, and assumed it was for you?
Other than the fact the enclosed card was made out ＂to Ramiel＂?
Damn it! Forgot I let the shopkeep fast-talk me into adding all the bells and whistles...
I trust we can now drop this silly charade? If so, it is my turn to ask the questions.
Why would you fail to give me a gift you clearly went to a good deal of trouble for?
That's not... I mean, you know...
If it is difficult for you to say it, why don't I hazard a guess?
You procrastinated for too long, we got swept up in a mission, and Dragonyule was over by the time we finally returned. Am I close?
Yeah, that's about the long and short of it. If I'd followed through after flubbing it that hard, you'd only have laughed at me.
You truly are a remarkable, incurable idiot.
HEY?! I take offense at that! ...I'm supposed to, right?
Just what manner of devil do you take me for?
I would never tease you! How could I feel anything but joy at receiving a lovely gift from the person I cherish above all others?
You...you mean it?
Why would I lie about something like that?
Though I'd have a few words of tough love, surely. If you fancy yourself so capable, learn to do things competently...and so on.
See! THERE'S the devil I know! Even if you don't tease, you still can't resist handing out your patented snarky advice.
Well, certainly. You've a lot of maturing left to do. Why wouldn't I offer advice?
If you're planning to stand beside me as an equal, I will require you to reach my level in all arenas.
At the very least, I have the social graces not to mumble and dither and fail to hand over a simple gift.
...Fine. You got me.
I just want to outgrow my old man. Not my fault he happens to be a giant.
Ha ha! All the better to set an example for my boy.
Yeah, yeah. Laugh it up while you can, 'cause next year's Dragonyule present will knock you flat on your angel rump.
Then I have something to look forward to all year. I can't wait to see how much you'll have grown by then.
(I guess showing how grateful I am for him raising me will have to wait at least a year.)
(After all, there's still mountains of stuff I need to learn from the guy...)
(I'll keep growing, and the day I stand with him as a peer, I'll hold my head high and tell him...thanks for everything.)
